intro: Myosotis macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered forget-me-not, is a herbaceous perennial native to New Zealand. It features showy, blue to violet flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of stems. The plant has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
